There is a lot of frequency overlap in this. Some solid EQ would really free up some room to add more to the tune. It sounds lacking because sounds don't have their own 'space'. You'll find after EQing and mixing this that the tune either sounds a lot fuller, as each element shines through more, or has obvious ranges (frequencies) that are begging to be filled with something.
I would start by cutting a lot of frequencies around the bass drum, or look into side chaining it to get the pulse feeling going.
Good luck!

Anyone using intel HD graphics with an AMD card (switchable graphics) still cannot launch the game. The similar NVIDIA workarounds do not work for AMD cards as AMD cards do not support on the fly switching with DirectX like NVIDIA does.
This is preventing A LOT of people from playing the game...

Anyone using intel HD graphics with an AMD card (switchable graphics) still cannot launch the game. The similar NVIDIA workarounds do not work for AMD cards as AMD cards do not support on the fly switching with DirectX like NVIDIA does.
This is preventing A LOT of people from playing the game...
This still only runs the game on the intel integrated card, not the AMD card.

You're running the game on your intel card though. The settings menu may display your full video memory, but the game is only running on the HD4000. Once you get past the prologue you're going to start noticing massive FPS drops.
If that's not the case, you should be getting 60fps at low settings like that. Let us know if so!

WRITING.TITLE: Game crashes post launcher with AMD switchable graphics
WRITING.TEXT:
Basically, the game crashes after the launcher does its thing. I can start the game if I disable my AMD card via device manager however then it runs at 1FPS as it's using the onboard card.
People seem to be having the same problem with NVIDIA cards, their workaround is to disable the graphics card and then enable it again once the game has launched. This doesn't work for us AMD users as switching the card on after launching causes the game to crash :(
If anyone has any thoughts or workarounds I'd love to hear about it. I've tried the beta drivers, rolling back to HP drivers, verifying cache, updating bio, windows update.

WRITING.TITLE: Crash on launch with AMD switchable graphics
WRITING.TEXT:
Bascially, the game crashes after the launcher does its thing. I can start the game if I disable my AMD card however then it runs at 1FPS as it's using the onboard card.
People seem to be having the same problem with NVIDIA cards, their workaround is to disable the graphics card and then enable it again once the game has launched. This doesn't work for us AMD users as switching the card on causes the game to crash :(
If anyone has any thoughts or workarounds I'd love to hear about it.
Also having this issue :( the NVIDIA workaround of disabling and enabling the device doesn't work for AMD as it crashes the game :(

that may be a tad extreme in most cases, I'd suggest gradually bringing your wider sounds inward toward the drop, one instrument doing this can often be enough. Would love to hear the result if you try it!!
Try to bring everything into the middle of the stereo field in your buildup, then release it all again as the song drops. Give it a try, maybe it's not for you but it's quite common

People seem to be saying samples in DnB aren't cleared. And that's not true at all for people releasing on major dnb labels (like audio). If it's prominent or just recognisable it's almost always cleared.
Licensed and 'cleared' can be different things also. Not every sample is licensed, but you'd be pressed to find samples that were never cleared (run by) the owners..

Right click the tempo and create an automation clip. The two knobs on the automation clips track in the sequencer now relate to the min and max value (in this case tempo).
Now switch your bpm to the lowest value and right click it - select copy value. Now right click on the left knob on the sequencer and - paste value.
Do this for the max value (max tempo) for the other knob. Alter the automation clip to either speed up, or cut straight to the higher BPM
enjoy!

I have a launchkey and to be honest it's nothing amazing.
The knobs along the top wiggle a lot in their slots, which can make small adjustments annoying. The pads are average. The only other pads we use are on a maschine, so perhaps they're just not as good as those, but we don't like the launchkey ones.
The keys themselves are fine however, decently responsive and feel nice to play.
We picked the launchkey up for 110, and for that price it's still fair. Just know it might not be the top line quality you're expecting.

No, never in our experience would we send or receive DAW project files.
If we're sending stems for a remix we bounce each of our mixer tracks (making final sends for things like drums or other bus'd tracks) and bounce to wav.
We usually keep things like reverb sends as separate wavto keep the stems as clean as possible.

we looked at a long polling option and probably could've gone that route too. In the end it only ever processed maybe 5-10 emails per day so it wasn't worth doing something we hadn't at the time explored. Solid suggestion though :)

yep, ours runs every 2 minutes. We were lucky enough to be able to host the email account on the same machine as the script - the script itself then pings another connector on our main systems.
We looked into writing a small daemon to check and ping but ended up using PHP for it all as it worked as promised :)
Correct!
Using the LFO shapes in the performer seems to work for us. Using the different curves essentially you can draw whatever you like :)

I've done this before for a similar situation. PHP actually has a pretty robust imap/email system.
Here's a great composer package :)
https://github.com/barbushin/php-imap
Basically, set a cron to run a script which checks for new emails. In your case you could simply ~~explode()~~ str_getcsv() the message body and get a super sweet array:)
